title: Euler’s Polyhedron Formula in mizar

items.abstract: <jats:p>Dialogue games are a two-player semantics for a variety of logics, including intuitionistic and classical logic.  Dialogues can be viewed as a kind of analytic calculus not unlike tableaux.  Can dialogue games be an effective foundation for proof search in intuitionistic logic (both first-order and propositional)?  We announce Kuno, an automated theorem prover for intuitionistic first-order logic based on dialogue games.</jats:p>
title: Dialogues for proof search

event.name: ARQNL 2014. Automated Reasoning in Quantified Non-Classical Logics

items.abstract: <jats:p>We announce a tool for mapping derivations produced by the E theorem</jats:p><jats:p>prover to Mizar proofs.  Our mapping complements earlier work that</jats:p><jats:p>generates problems for automated theorem provers from Mizar inference</jats:p><jats:p>checking problems.  We describe the tool, explain the mapping, and</jats:p><jats:p>show how we solved some of the difficulties that arise in mapping</jats:p><jats:p>proofs between different logical formalisms, even when they are based</jats:p><jats:p>on the same notion of logical consequence, as Mizar and E are (namely,</jats:p><jats:p>first-order classical logic with identity).</jats:p>
title: Escape to Mizar from ATPs

event.name: PAAR-2012. Third Workshop on Practical Aspects of Automated Reasoning

items.abstract: <jats:p>This note reports on some experiments, using a handful of standard automated reasoning tools, for exploring Steinitz-Rademacher polyhedra, which are models of a certain first-order theory of incidence structures. This theory and its models, even simple ones, presents significant, geometrically fascinating challenges for automated reasoning tools are.</jats:p>
title: Exploring Steinitz-Rademacher Polyhedra: a Challenge for Automated Reasoning Tools

items.abstract:
<jats:title>The Rank+Nullity Theorem</jats:title>
        <jats:p>The rank+nullity theorem states that, if <jats:italic>T</jats:italic> is a linear transformation from a finite-dimensional vector space <jats:italic>V</jats:italic> to a finite-dimensional vector space <jats:italic>W</jats:italic>, then dim(<jats:italic>V</jats:italic>) = rank(<jats:italic>T</jats:italic>) + nullity(<jats:italic>T</jats:italic>), where rank(<jats:italic>T</jats:italic>) = dim(im(<jats:italic>T</jats:italic>)) and nullity(<jats:italic>T</jats:italic>) = dim(ker(<jats:italic>T</jats:italic>)). The proof treated here is standard; see, for example, [14]: take a basis <jats:italic>A</jats:italic> of ker(<jats:italic>T</jats:italic>) and extend it to a basis <jats:italic>B</jats:italic> of <jats:italic>V</jats:italic>, and then show that dim(im(<jats:italic>T</jats:italic>)) is equal to |<jats:italic>B - A</jats:italic>|, and that <jats:italic>T</jats:italic> is one-to-one on <jats:italic>B - A.</jats:italic></jats:p>
title: The Rank+Nullity Theorem

items.abstract: <jats:p><p style="text-align: justify;">El presente artículo aborda el tópico de la metacognición como una alternativa factible, para fundamentar y regular el proceso de enseñanza y aprendizaje. Una didáctica metacognitiva contribuye a hacer más consciente y eficiente la acción del docente, y, al mismo tiempo, hace más interesante y fructuosa la del estudiante.</p></jats:p>
title: Hacia una didáctica de la metacognición

items.abstract: <jats:p>Organizational knowledge, as well as their different manifestations, may play a critical role for effective development of the firm processes and products (Kogut and Zander, 1996; Teece, 1998; Alegre and Lapiedra, 2005). The present work explores the influence that the different manifestations of organizational knowledge, or structural capital, show on the innovation capability of professional service firms. To achieve this purpose, in a first section an exploratory factor analysis is carried out. From it, the main blocks of organizational capital are obtained. In the next step, the basic hypotheses about the positive influence of these types of structural assets, on firm innovation are presented.</jats:p>
title: Structural Capital and Innovation Capabilities
